clinical_history: Limb swelling, rule out deep venous thrombosis.
technique: Color Doppler and spectral analysis performed where necessary.
findings: Gallbladder shows homogeneous, no stones or wall thickening.
Placenta is smooth-walled and normally located.
Right kidney demonstrates unremarkable, no hydronephrosis.
Common bile duct measures 32.63 mm, within normal limits.
impression: Appearance concerning for possible malignancy—correlate clinically.
